intro: Euphrasia matsudae, commonly known as Japanese eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Euphrasia matsudae is valued in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
